creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: oval-shaped print: portrait of a seated man in cap with PL elbow resting on table; holding pipe in mouth with PL hand, and a bowl or pouch to the pipe with opposite hand; paraphernalia on table
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

-- in graphite on verso: etch 152 | B42 | APG 7546
markings: blue stamp on verso, lower center: Semen Nicolaevitch Mossoloff (Lugt 2362); black stamp on verso, lower center, unidentified collector\'s mark (Lugt 2695)
provenance: Semen Nicolaevitch Mossoloff (1812-1880), Moscow and Dresden; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until November 16, 1985; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, upper left: [AV.O.] (with A and V combined)
title: The Smoker
